messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "aviv_benyosef" <aviv.by@...> wrote:
>
> FWIW, I know that I and most of my colleagues rather having the
> test-executer "close" and overhead-free(ish).
> Running my tests from the shell or IDE with a few clicks/key-
presses
> is a strong requirement.
> I think that the web environment is an overkill.
> But it may just be me.
>
> Cheers,
> Aviv.
>

Hi Aviv,

Thanks for your comments. We are working on trying to reduce the
overheads for the JUnit tester as much as possible, as well as
provide an ANT task to run our tool, so people can tie it in with
their ANT builds.

I appreciate that purely for ad-hoc execution, then it can easily be
done via an IDE or the shell prompt, in which case this could be an
over engineered solution - so I can see your point of view. But as
well as execution, we're aiming to provide something that will
schedule automated test runs and provide historical results for
their test suites and each case executed etc.

Cheers,
Les.
